body_html:
I think @egpbos exposed a bug in tf.select and how it computes gradients.

In [15]: x = tf.Variable(0.0)
In [16]: f = tf.select(x > 0, -x*tf.log(x), 0.0)
In [17]: g, = tf.gradients(f, [x])
In [18]: sess.run(x.initializer)
In [19]: g.eval()
Out[19]: nan

I think @egpbos exposed a bug in tf.select and how it computes gradients.
In [15]: x = tf.Variable(0.0)
In [16]: f = tf.select(x > 0, -x*tf.log(x), 0.0)
In [17]: g, = tf.gradients(f, [x])
In [18]: sess.run(x.initializer)
In [19]: g.eval()
Out[19]: nan
body:
I think @egpbos exposed a bug in `tf.select` and how it computes gradients. 

```
In [15]: x = tf.Variable(0.0)
In [16]: f = tf.select(x > 0, -x*tf.log(x), 0.0)
In [17]: g, = tf.gradients(f, [x])
In [18]: sess.run(x.initializer)
In [19]: g.eval()
Out[19]: nan
```
